intro: Suaeda feliciana, commonly known as the saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, demonstrating remarkable adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, greenish flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. Suaeda feliciana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
